citeinfo.origin: National Park Service, Bryce Canyon National Park, Resource Management
citeinfo.title: Bryce Canyon National Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary

descript.abstract: This is a vector polygon file showing the boundary of Bryce Canyon National Park. The coordinates for this dataset were heads up digitized at a scale of 1:24,000 off of a USGS 7.5 minute DRG using ArcView 3.2.
descript.purpose: To show the location of the boundary of Bryce Canyon National Park. The intended use of all data in the park's GIS library is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.
descript.supplinf:
At Bryce Canyon National Park faulting and erosion shaped colorful Claron limestones, sandstones, and mudstones into thousands of spires, fins, pinnacles, and mazes. Collectively called "hoodoos," these colorful and whimsical formations stand in horseshoe-shaped amphitheaters along the eastern edge of the Paunsaugunt Plateau in Southern Utah.
Bryce Canyon National Park was proclaimed a national monument June 8, 1923. June 7, 1924 it was renamed and redesignated Utah National Park. February 25, 1928 it was renamed to its present day title "Bryce Canyon National Park".
Bryce Canyon National Park is named for pioneer Ebenezer Bryce who came to the area in 1875. He was sent by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints to settle this area. Bryce built a road to the plateau top to retrieve firewood and timber. Local people called the canyon with the strange rock formations near Ebenezer's home "Bryce's Canyon".

place.placekey: Bryce Canyon National Park, BRCA, Utah, Garfield County, Kane County, NPS, National Park Service, USA, US, United States, North America

idinfo.useconst: To be used at the same scale as the source material.

browse.browsed: The graphic shows the park's boundary.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy was tested by interactively querying and verifying on screen with the source materials. In addition, the attributes were compared against a master set of valid attributes.

dataqual.logic: There are no duplicate features. Polygonal features begin and end at the same point, line feature contain no erroneous over shoots or under shoots.

horizpa.horizpar: Estimated accuracies in the X and Y direction of 1 to 20 meters from the true location. The horizontal positional accuracy was tested by verifying the location of the data on-screen relative to the corresponding 1:24000 USGS DRG (digital raster graph) in the same projection and datum. The relative positions between the two datasets onscreen was compared to the hardcopy map used as the base for digitizing.

srctime.srccurr: date of aerial photos used to created DOQQs

srcinfo.srccontr: Used as a background image onscreen to help establish relative positions for heads up digitizing new features.

procstep.procdesc: Added the DRG into ArcView 3.2. Created a new polygon dataset. Using the graphics drawing tools available, sketched new features into the dataset based on prior knowledge of the area shown in the background. Created user defined fields in the feature's attribute table. Interactively populated the fields based on prior knowledge of the features. All features and attributes were verified onscreen.
Was updated upon receipt of 2002 DOQQ's. Feature data was compared to features in the DRG, DOQQs and USGS Topoquads for accuracy. The Data Manager at the park verified all features and attributes.

overview.eaover: The first 2 items in the attribute table are the default attribute information found in the ArcView shapefile format. The next 2 items, BND_BRCA_ & BND_BRCA_I, were created while in ArcView to add additional field note information. The BND_BRCA_ attribute is a numeric field with a populated value of 2. The BND_BRCA_I attribute is a numeric field with a populated value of 1. The last item, ACREAGE was generated by ArcView software.

This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
